text:
Does anyone know if there are security implications for archiving a repo that is in the General Registry? <https://docs.github.com/en/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/about-archiving-repositories>

Hoping to do some cleanup of an org that has some unmaintained packages, but want to make sure this won't break something or expose some kind of exploit.

elements.text: Does anyone know if there are security implications for archiving a repo that is in the General Registry?
Hoping to do some cleanup of an org that has some unmaintained packages, but want to make sure this won't break something or expose some kind of exploit.

text:
> When a repository is archived, its issues, pull requests, code, labels, milestones, projects, wiki, releases, commits, tags, branches, reactions, code scanning alerts, and comments become read-only.
so it will still be available

elements.text: When a repository is archived, its issues, pull requests, code, labels, milestones, projects, wiki, releases, commits, tags, branches, reactions, code scanning alerts, and comments become read-only.
so it will still be available

text: should be ok AFAIK. The only issue I can think of is if there’s some kind of security bug already in the code, and archiving means it won’t get updates to fix the bug when it’s discovered. But I think in that case you could just un-archive it and tag a patch release.
